summary: An internal email from August 13, 2019, providing an update on personnel actions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It details administrative leave for two SHU staff members, the temporary reassignment of the Warden, and the appointment of an Acting Warden, noting that the information is not yet public and a DOJ statement is pending.

events.title: Personnel Actions Following Epstein Death Investigation
events.description: The Director (Dal) placed two staff members from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on administrative leave, and the Department of Justice (DOJ) required the Warden to be temporarily reassigned. An Acting Warden was appointed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC NYM).

events.title: Pending DOJ Public Statement
events.description: The email notes that the information regarding the personnel changes is not yet public and that the Department of Justice will issue a statement later the same day.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC NYM or NYM)
NERO (Northeast Regional Office, likely of the Federal Bureau of Prisons)
keyFacts: Two staff members who worked in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York were placed on administrative leave on August 13, 2019, pending an investigation.
The Warden of MCC New York was temporarily reassigned to the Northeast Regional Office (NERO) by order of the Department of Justice.
OTV Warden El was appointed as the Acting Warden at MCC New York following the previous warden's reassignment.
These personnel actions were directly related to an ongoing investigation, implicitly connected to the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein two days prior.
The information was confidential at the time of the email, with a public statement from the DOJ expected later that day.
